text: William Hilliard Price2017 Brier Media Guide: Previous Rosters (born 1928) is a Canadian former curler. He played as lead on the 1957 and 1958 Brier-winning Team Alberta, skipped by Matt Baldwin. He was from Edmonton and also played basketball and baseball locally."Baldwin Quartet Takes Third Title", Lethbridge Herald, Monday, February 18, 1957, Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada, pg. 7http://ashfm.ca/hall-of-fame-honoured-members/browse/multisport/price-bill He married to Margaret Jeanne (Peggy) Blundellhttp://www.wetaskiwinonline.com/museum/blundell_mae/index.html in 1950. Price grew up in Saskatoon and attended the University of Alberta where he studied chemical engineering. There, he won the Gene Carrigan Trophy as the Edmonton's most outstanding junior athlete, as he was a top basketball player for the Alberta Golden Bears and was a top city baseball player at the time. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Brier champions Category:Curlers from Alberta Category:1928 births Category:Canadian male curlers Category:University of Alberta alumni Category:Sportspeople from Saskatoon Category:Sportspeople from Edmonton Category:Canadian men's basketball players
